roleset.name: sleep, slumbering
roleset.note: SLEEP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls snooze-40.4. (from sleep.01-v)
ASLEEP-J NOTES: RoleseMember of Vncls snooze-40.4. (from asleep.01-j)

example.name: usually intransitive
example.text: I'm not saying advertising revenue isn't important,'' she says, ``but I couldn't sleep at night'' if the magazine bowed to a company because they once took out an ad.
example.arg: if the magazine bowed to a company because they once took out an ad

example.name: been there, done that
example.text: Some nights he slept under his desk.

example.name: quite an alarm clock, eh?
example.text: I'd slept through my only previous brush with natural disaster, a tornado 15 or so summers ago near Traverse City, Mich., so I was unprepared for one reaction to such things: the urge to talk about them.
example.arg: through my only previous brush with natural disaster, a tornado 15 or so summers ago near Traverse City, Mich.

example.name: with cognate object
example.text: John sleeps the sleep of the damned.

example.name: Arg0
example.text: His sleeping was erratic, his mind began wandering, seeing things, speaking and acting unusually.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The crowing of the rooster interrupted his sleeping a deep sleep.

example.name: Arg0 only, most typical usage
example.text: I feel your pain - enjoy the evening , once they 're asleep

example.name: Cognate object realization with adjective?
example.text: I was asleep with the sleep of dreams.

example.name: What an excuse!
example.text: But I was asleep through the whole thing, your honour!

example.name: sleep with
example.text: Mr. Noriega had learned that a local union leader was sleeping with the wife of his deputy.
example.arg: with the wife of his deputy

example.name: sleep together
example.text: John and Mary don't sleep together.

roleset.name: sleep away: consume a time period while asleep

example.name: sleepy boy
example.text: [David Cortlandt]-1 , [*-1]having slept away a day and a night , came awake in a plank farmhouse on the Harlem River near Spuyten Duyvil .

roleset.name: sleep off: get rid of via sleep

role.descr: one getting rid of something, corrupted entity

example.name: but what is 'it'?
example.text: Ma never went near the old man when-1 he was sleeping it off [*T*-1] .

roleset.name: sleep away from home, at someone else's house
roleset.note: SLEEP_OVER-V NOTES: Framed by Claire. Member of Vncls lodge-46. (from sleep.05-v)

roles.note: Phrases specifying where someone sleeps over: "At Susie's house..." will be argM-LOC (from sleep.05-v)

example.name: No Location
example.text: More questionable, even criminal, than Michael's alleged fooling around with other kids were *T*-1 the parents who *T*-3 allowed, even encouraged [their children]-2 *PRO*-2 to sleep over and perhaps share the same bed with someone whose sexual predilictions *T*-4 have been suspect since 1991.

example.name: With location
example.text: John-1 wanted *PRO*-1 to sleep over at Mary's house, but she flatly refused.

roleset.name: close to falling asleep
roleset.note: SLEEPY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. relation to 'asleep.01', sleep.01. (from sleepy.01-j)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: I was sleepy from the altitude
